evidence.pdf_reference: the cell type reactor shows negligible photoactivity compared to TiO 2 coated inside microchannels.The yield of CH 4 was increased from 7.7 to 82 lmole g catal.A1 by replacing cell type reactor with microchannel monolith photoreactor.The production of CH 4 further increased using monolith reactor and MMTTiO 2 catalyst.The CH 4 yield in monolith photoreactor was 78 higher than cell type reactor over MMTTiO 2 catalyst.Similar trends could be seen in the production of CO using both types of reactor

CO using both types of reactor systems.This phenomenon can be explained based on the illuminated surface area available for CO 2 reduction.In catalyst suspended over the bottom of the reactor, the exposed surface area available for absorption of light irradiations is much lower as compared to catalyst coated over microchannels.The lower yield rate in the cell type reactor was also due to low light utilization efficiency.There are also mass transfer limitations in the cell type reactors 24,33.Conversely,

type reactors 24,33.Conversely, higher conversion efficiency has been demonstrated with the monolith photoreactor due to its larger surface area and more efficient light utilization resulting in higher photonic efficiency.The highest efficiency in monolith photoreactor is supposedly because of the higher mass transfer rate and CO 2 adsorption inside the microchannels due to very thin film coating having negligible diffusional effects 33,41.
